entry.title: It has been 2 years
entry.content:
:us:

It has been 2 years. Two years since I posted on this blog. I wasnâ€™t prepared to write anything, really. I almost felt compelled to write a â€œPreviously on My Blogâ€, but thought it would have been too much of Me Me Me, in a post that is already about Me Me Me.

I have been rediscovering my life back home in France & realized it was sort of inevitable to have to start a little bit from scratch acting-wise. It was expected after all, I had moved back to be closer to my family knowing I would have to adjust professionally. And it has been just that. But now, I feel more compelled to come out of my shell and start reconnecting with the world!

Since being back, I had a role on French TV, I acted in several short films, I continued recording voice-overs (I even was the French voice of Oscar ISAAC for a commercial) and I have been sending quite the pile of individual e-mails to people in the acting world stating that I exist. Good news: it appears I do. But it also appears I am not the only one doing it ğŸ˜‰

Anyway, happy to be back. If you are interested in whatâ€™s been new, my Linktree page (https://linktr.ee/yohanbelmin) would be a great place to start.

How have you been?

As always, lots of love, and of course, a happy happy (happy) new year,

-Yohan
entry.summary: It has been 2 years. Two years since I posted on this blog...

entry.title: Moving to France
entry.content:
:fr:

I hopeÂ you are finding the time to relax a little this summerÂ (at theÂ very least in spirit!)

After 12 formative years in NY, I have decided to move my home base to Paris, thisÂ OctoberÂ 1st.Â Priorities change over time andÂ it now makes much more sense to me toÂ be closer to my family. It has obviously been an unbelievable learning experience: IÂ immersed myself inÂ a new culture, IÂ perfected a new language &Â I established myself as an artist.Â 

Being an immigrant madeÂ meÂ more compassionate,Â andÂ made me realize over the years that the country that I originally wanted to distance myself from, was bloody damn niceÂ (pardon my Flemish): Itâ€™s beautiful,Â I speak the language, I can apply to any job that I want, I eat well, I drink well andÂ I can complain and be accepted for it ;) (by the way, Iâ€™mÂ copyrightingÂ the nextÂ self-help book about the â€œPower of Complainingâ€: it will be useless AND a NYTimes Best Seller.)Â In all seriousness, FranceÂ is home for me, and I am now ready toÂ tryÂ home. AndÂ I still keep my USÂ ArtistÂ Visa for potential work overseas. I will however nowÂ refuse my Green Card if I get it late SeptemberÂ as I no longer seek permanent residency (the irony of it all!)

But enough with me, how are you?

Much love, asÂ always, and be merry!

-Yohan
entry.summary: After 12 formative years in NY, I have decided to move my home base to Paris, thisÂ OctoberÂ 1st!

entry.title: In â€œCinderellaâ€ @ The Metropolitan Opera
entry.content:
Happy holidays to you, wherever you are in the world!

A very quick update to let you know that I am reprising the role of the â€œHeraldâ€ this holiday season in a new 95-minute & English version of â€œCinderellaâ€ by Jules Massenet, at the Metropolitan Opera. The show opens tonight, and will run until January 3, 2022.

My new Visa application has also been submitted yesterday, so hopefully I will get approved on time to be able to finish the run. I canâ€™t remember ever asking for a Christmas / Hanukkah miracle, but todayâ€™s the day!

Wishing you all the best for this end of the year. I hope you are doing wonderfully well.

Much love, as always,

-Yohan
entry.summary: I am reprising the role of the "Herald" this holiday season in a new 95-minute & English version of "Cinderella"

entry.title: Back in NY
entry.content:
I hope you are doing well. I really had nothing big to share since last January, hence the lack of updates. But things have changed recently:

1) I have moved back to NY 2 week ago. And yes, I had to do another 2-week quarantine outside of France to enter the US which, at this point, is just a nice vacation really. At least, the travel ban is now ending in November.

2) I was able to join the Actorsâ€™ Equity Association (AEA) thanks to their Open Access program + the fact that they now accept visa holders. I am excited to now have the opportunity to one day play French people on and off Broadway ;)

3) I am looking for a long-term room to rent in NYC (or, hey, an apartment?). If any of you know of a great deal, or know someone who might, I am all ears. It would be starting Nov. 1, and the date is flexible.

4) I did not (yet) get my Green Card even after winning the lottery, and I might not. Briefly: there was a deadline after which you would lose your chance to get one + the embassies were closed and were not delivering visas for a long time due to Covid, BUT 25,000 of us sued the US DoS and won, HOWEVER the judge is only preserving a third of the Green Cards. To sum up: fun times. Looking forward to Season 2!

5) Which mean: I will most probably have to renew my Visa a 4th time for safety in the upcoming months. I will once again need the help of some of you, and might reach out soon enough about this specific subject.

Thatâ€™s for me, still holding on to wanting to live in the US for some unconscious and probably valid reason!

How about you? How has everything been with you?

Much love,

-Yohan
entry.summary: I hope you are doing well. I really had nothing big to share since last January, hence the lack of updates. But things have changed recently:

entry.title: VO update + Life
entry.content:
How is life? (I was tempted to create a survey with two possible choices: a) â€œGood, actually!â€ or b) â€œDuhâ€¦â€.)

On my end, and I believe for a lot of people too, a lot has happened since I wrote in June. Letâ€™s be honest: after doing a 2-week quarantine in Mexico in September, I managed to make it back to Texas to reunite with my partner, only to witness the relationship end quite quickly and move back to France. Itâ€™s sad, for sure, but I canâ€™t help to see some humour in it too considering what 2020 has been in general + the fact that after re-reading my journal, my new year resolution for last year was to â€œtravel and be more adventurousâ€! Hey, at least I am a man of my word ;)

Now for the (much) better part:

1) I added a dedicated voice-over page on my website, and uploaded 3 VO demos.
2) I now have a home studio set-up to record VO work.
3) And, I am now SAG-AFTRA Eligible thanks to a voice-over I recorded last year!

I am thinking of you all, I hope you are well, and I am sending the brightest vibes your way.

How is life? (for real.) Iâ€™d love to hear from you.

Much love,

-Yohan
entry.summary: How is life? (I was tempted to create a survey with two possible choices: a) â€œGood, actually!â€ or b) â€œDuhâ€¦â€.)

entry.title: A Long-Overdue Update
entry.content:
First of all, I hope you are doing well wherever you are in these unique times. I am currently back home in France waiting for the US border to reopen (at some point). I realize I havenâ€™t sent any update in 10 months, but who said a newsletter had to be written more often than that!

Some recent news to share:

1) La Fille Du RÃ©giment, the opera I was a part of early 2019 at the MET, will be streaming for free this Monday June 29 from 7:30pm ET to June 30 at 6:30pm ET at this link. By the way, here is the complete schedule of all the upcoming operas being streamed.

2) I was selected at the Green Card lottery this year, after 10 years of playing. However due to the latest Executive Order on Immigration (among many other factors that I will not mention here for the purpose of enjoying oneâ€™s day), chances to actually get it this time are slimmer than other years. For example, the majority of people who were selected last year simply wonâ€™t get it at this point. But hey, thereâ€™s a chance!

In the meantime, I hope the second half of 2020 will slowly bring us everything that we wished for last New Yearâ€™s Eve.

Much love,

-Yohan
entry.summary: La Fille du RÃ©giment will be streaming for free this Monday June 29 + I was selected at the Green Card lottery in unique times.

entry.title: â€œCendrillonâ€ & â€œLa Fille du RÃ©gimentâ€ @ Lincoln Center Plaza

link.title: "Cendrillon" & "La Fille du RÃ©giment" @ Lincoln Center Plaza

entry.content:
I hope you are doing well and maybe taking advantage of the summer to find time for yourself, may it be resting, traveling, re-assessing, or simply continuing the good work your were already doing â˜€ï¸

A quick email to let you know that, starting August 24th, the Metropolitan Opera will start its 11th Summer HD Festival which will present 10 free outdoor opera screenings in Lincoln Center Plaza in NY. The 2 operas I was a part of: â€œCendrillonâ€ & â€œLa Fille du RÃ©gimentâ€, will be screened respectively on August 29 & August 31. If youâ€™re interested in discovering these operas, or simply want to see me perform in French on stage, you can find all the info here ğŸ˜‰

Wishing you a wonderful day,

Much love,

-Yohan

entry.title: A lot of great news!
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

After spending 2 months on finalizing the renewal of my work Visa, and waiting on the answer, I can now focus on sharing all the good news:

1) MyÂ work visaÂ got renewed for 3 more years.
2) AnÂ article was publishedÂ about my recent work at the MET in â€œLe Journal du VÃ©sinetâ€, the magazine of my hometown.
3) I voiced a French crow in theÂ â€œBrawl Starsâ€ game app commercial.
4) And finally,Â I got cast once againÂ at The Metropolitan Opera, this time inÂ La Fille du RÃ©giment, in which I will be playing the role of the Notary starting Feb 7, opposite Kathleen Turner!

Hereâ€™s to 2019!

Much love to you all,

-Yohan
entry.summary: I got cast once again at The Metropolitan Opera, this time in La Fille du RÃ©giment, in which I will be playing the role of the Notary starting Feb 7!
